intro: Urostachys macbridei, commonly known as the MacBride's stachys, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves, typical of the mint family. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Urostachys macbridei is often found in rocky or sandy soils in mountainous regions.
